info.book: Workshop on Computer and Internet Supported Education in Language and Speech Technology
info.title: Diamonds on My Windshield: The Use of Computer-Based Instruction in Computational Linguistics

sections.heading: Abstract
text: Many disciplines currently have more or less organized activities concerned with developing resources to support Internet-and computer-based instruction.
This talk will examine this area, with particular focus on the questions:
• What is special about computational linguistics in terms of its subject matter, history and existing resources?
• What is the current state of resources in our area?
• When is this kind of instruction justified?
• What are the problems to be faced and what solutions might there be?
We will see that in some cases computer-based intervention can lead to enhanced learning, and so provide a non-economic justification for the use of such techniques.
Also, current technological developments offer part of the answer to the problem that such resources are often not reused.
